snippet: South Carolina, which holds a primary in 11 days, is fast becoming an early proving ground, and for some Republican candidates, a likely final opportunity.
abstract: South Carolina is fast becoming an early proving ground for the Republican candidates in a volatile and unpredictable political season; question remains whether Tea Party supporters will choose moderate frontrunner Mitt Romney or coalesce around a more conservative candidate like Rick Santorum.
lead_paragraph: South Carolina, which holds a primary in 11 days, is fast becoming an early proving ground, and for some Republican candidates, a likely final opportunity.

headline.seo: South Carolina Primary Make or Break for Some Republicans
headline.main: In South Carolina, Hopes of Passing a Crucial Test
headline.print_headline: In South Carolina, Hopes Of Passing a Crucial Test
